channel.title: GKE Quickstart on Tools for running HashiCorp Vault on Kubernetes

item.title: GKE Quickstart
item.description: Running Kubernetes on Google Kubernetes Engine Following example will use pharmer to create a Kubernetes cluster with 1 worker node on on Google Kubernetes Engine. Before you start As a prerequisite, you need to have pharmer installed. To install pharmer use the setup guide Pharmer storage To store your cluster and credential resource, you can configure pharmer to use local file system or postgres database. In this document we will use local file system (vfs) as a storage provider.
